DOC.brief_summary: This ancillary study `` JUMODA '' ( National Prospective Comparative Study Mode Delivery Twins ) study : please see NCT01987063 . The main objective study investigate role mode delivery ( vaginal versus cesarean ) risk factor occurrence urinary incontinence 3 month post-delivery primiparous woman deliver twin 34 week pregnancy .
DOC.brief_title: Perineal Consequences Twin Pregnancies According Mode Delivery
DOC.detailed_description: The secondary objective study compare follow element primiparous mother give birth twin vaginally versus caesarean section 34 week pregnancy ( comparison make 3 month ant 12 month post-partum ) : A . Diagnosis , type severity urinary incontinence via ICIQ-UI questionnaire B. Urinary , anorectal perineal symptom via PFDI-20 questionnaire C. Quality life relate urinary , anorectal pelvic floor symptom via PFIQ-7 questionnaire D. Sexuality via PISQ-12 questionnaire E. General quality life via SF-12 questionnaire
DOC.criteria: The patient must give his/her inform sign consent The patient must insure beneficiary health insurance plan The patient available 12 month followup follow delivery The patient include JUMODA study Primiparous Birth 2 live child 34 week pregnancy Adult patient guardianship Patient judicial protection It prove impossible correctly inform patient Birth occur 34 week pregnancy Birth result 2 living child
